intro: Ruelliola grevei, commonly known as the African rock orchid, is a small, terrestrial orchid native to southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. The plant produces compact, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive, narrow lip. It has a short, creeping rhizome and is characterized by its simple, linear leaves. Ruelliola grevei is a rare and specialized species, often requiring specific environmental conditions to thrive.
